fields.description:
When you select a line of code to create a comment, the opening of the comment box causes the code you are looking at to jump. This is very off-putting.

-1. Jump to the side because the gutter columns showing line number, author and changeset id expand. This occurs on Safari and Chrome, but not on Firefox. This occurs on 3.4.6-SNAPSHOT and 3.5.0-SNAPSHOT-
#1 is not regression and is moved to the new issue https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CRUC-6870

2. Vertical jump when the diff is large enough to fill the window. This happens on Safari, Chrome and Firefox. This only occurs on 3.5.0-SNAPSHOT.
fields.summary: Creating a review comment on a line of code makes the source jump around

fields.description:
To improve the speed of indexing a single repository, Crucible should process branches in parallel if possible.

* User #1 pushes a large number of changes to branch #1
* Crucible starts indexing those changes to pull them in and allow for reviews to be made against them (all 100 file changes currently need to be indexed prior to new reviews being created)
* User #2 pushes a small change to branch #2 in the same repository
* The changes on branch #2 are at the bottom of the queue to be indexed and won't be available until all changes from branch #1 are indexed

This causes a large delay to see the the changes appear in Crucible and be available for review.
fields.summary: Allow parallel indexing of branches in a single repository

fields.description:
I can edit the name or objectives of a Crucible review through the web interface, but there appears to be no way to do the same thing through the REST API.

I've tried posting to /rest-service/reviews-v1 with the reviewData->permaId->id field filled in with the id of the review I wish to modify, but that results in a 500 error.
fields.summary: Can't change name or objectives via REST API

fields.description:
The loadFrxAjax request is slow and insufficiently cached.  It can make several copies of the content for the sake of low-memory diffing, which it sometimes recalculates.  This results in high IO load as well as high CPU use.

The performance is worse the larger the file and the more revisions of the file in the review.

This _may_ only be a problem when using [Storing all the revisions under review|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Storing+all+revisions+under+review]. We need to test that.

This _seems_ to be a _somewhat_ recent regression in 3.4.4.  E.g. it's been noticed a bit in 3.4.4 by one customer who has experienced performance degradation since 2.10 and an internal instance that has also had hardware changes.

Initial investigation yielded various specific performance issues but none that explained a regression.
fields.summary: loadFrxAjax has high CPU and IO impact

Test Scenaro:dsdsd\\

Steps to reproduce:

fields.summary: System not validates less then today date in search

fields.summary: Unable to add Git repository into Crucible

fields.description:
Fisheye/Crucible has an isTest method that attempts to guess, as a last resort, whether a file is textual or binary.

If it can't detect that the file is various known text types by the leading bytes, it checks the value of the first 20k bytes in the file and if any are outside the range 1 - 127, it decides the file must be binary.

This occasionally causes problems with files containing occasional values outside that range that are in ASCII-like but not ASCII formats. 

Alternatively we should delete our own attempts to detect textness and use a library for this. Some seem to exist.

It would probably be better to be a bit more lenient, and assume that if a file's bytes are _mostly_  in a texty looking range, then it's still better to show it as text than binary.  If a file is 5% boxes then I'm probably still happy to look at it.  The %age could be a system property.
fields.summary: Binary file detection by content type should allow some unexpected values

fields.description:
Given: some reviewers have completed the review

When: adding more content to a review through the {{/rest-service/reviews-v1/\{id\}/addFile}} API endpoint

Problem: the reviewers are still set to complete, even though new files have been added to the review.

Similar issue that has been fixed for adding content through the website: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CRUC-6808
fields.summary: The reviewers are not set to uncomplete after adding new content via REST API
code review

fields.description:
When I originally tried to use /rest-service/reviews-v1/{cid}/uncomplete through an Outlook macro I received and error stating that I did not have permission to change the review to uncomplete. I then when to the permission settings and adjusted uncomplete to allow any logged in user to perform this function.

However, now when I attempt to call the command through POST I receive an operation aborted error. There is no documentation on the API page as to how the POST call should be made.

Is there an XML structure that is needed?

This is the code that makes the API Call (written in VBA)

'        tUrl = serverInfo & "/rest-service/reviews-v1/" & crucibleId & "/uncomplete"
'        Set xmlHttp = CreateObject("Microsoft.XMLHTTP")
'        xmlHttp.Open "POST", tUrl, False
'        xmlHttp.setRequestHeader "Content-Type", "application/xml"
'        xmlHttp.setRequestHeader "Authorization", "Basic " & authorization
'        Err.Clear
'        On Error Resume Next 'ignore an error if xmlHttp.Send causes one
'            xmlHttp.Send
'            If Err.Number <> 0 Then
'                MsgBox Err.Description
'                MsgBox Err.Number
'                error caused when attempting to send request
'                Err.Clear
'                Exit Function
'            End If
'        On Error GoTo 0
fields.summary: Unable to use Uncomplete API Call

fields.description:
Currently, Crucible only support anchoring patch created with the word 'revision' in lowercase character, eg:
{noformat}
Index: test.txt
===================================================================
--- test.txt	(revision 153)
+++ test.txt	(working copy)
@@ -10,4 +10,6 @@
{noformat}

If the patch is created in German locale SVN, the patch have the word 'Revision' instead of 'revision', eg:
{noformat}
Index: test.txt
===================================================================
--- test.txt	(Revision 153)
+++ test.txt	(Arbeitskopie)
@@ -10,4 +10,6 @@
{noformat}

However, Crucible couldn't detect the revision of the patch from German locale SVN as '153'. It use the string 'Revision 153' as the revision in Crucible review.

Crucible should detect the word 'revision' without case sensitive to support German locale SVN.
fields.summary: Support German language patch
Repository and branch name remains in sidebar when all the files have been removed

fields.description:
When a file is added using the Crucible Web Interface, the review history is updated.

However, when using the the Rest API: {{/rest-service/reviews-v1/\{id\}/addFile}}
The review history is not updated.

The call is made within an Outlook Macro using a post call to populate the fields necessary to upload a file.

I have attached a .txt file with the function that is making the call. The programming language is VBA

See the attached screenshots. File {{from_web}} was uploaded through the web interface and {{from_rest}} was uploaded using the REST API. Only the {{from_web}} file appears in the review history.
fields.summary: Review History Doesn't Update When Adding Files through Rest API

fields.description:
I'm not sure if it is about Crucible or maybe FishEye, as we are using both
together here (with Subversion), so move this issue where appropriate
please.

The problem is that in the diff view it is impossible to see the difference
between spaces and tabs. Developers far too often use tabs instead of
spaces and vice versa, or leave hanging spaces at the end of the line.

When viewing the diff with Vim in Linux, I can easily see that by setting
Vim as follows:
{quote}
" See nice indicators for tabs and trailing spaces:
set listchars=tab:>-,trail:˽
set list
" Make them as little annoying as possible:
highlight SpecialKey ctermfg=darkgrey
{quote}

However with Crucible+FIshEye that is not possible.

The attached picture illustrates how I see this in Vim. It would be very
useful if I could achieve a similar view in Crucible:
!VimListChars.png!
fields.summary: Make diff show difference between tabs and spaces

fields.description:
The [documentation|https://docs.atlassian.com/fisheye-crucible/latest/wadl/crucible.html#rest-service:reviews-v1:id:remind] for the {{/rest-service/reviews-v1/\{id\}/remind}} endpoint does not provide documentation for what should be included in the JSON or XML request.

Looking through the source code, it looks like the following XML should be sent in the POST request.

{noformat}<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<remindMessage>
    <message>Reminder message</message>
    <recipients>jeff</recipients>
</remindMessage>{noformat}
fields.summary: /rest-service/reviews-v1/{id}/remind endpoint documentation does not provide acceptable request representations

fields.description:
It's typical race condition thus may be hard to reproduce it locally but you need.

You need at least 2 files (more files are better to slow down loading of all reviews)
file with long content and file with short content.

You have to perform these steps fast
1) Refresh review
2) Click on file with long content - wait to load
3) Click on file with short content (it has to display loading indicator!)
4) Click back on file with long content and wait couple of seconds (until short file is eventually loaded)

Crucible truncates the scroll.
fields.summary: Crucible truncates review code

fields.description:
When attempting to use the API call: /rest-service/reviews-v1/

an error occurs. Within the API documentation there is no explanation of the POST xml structure or the GET xml structure.

The reviewers for the review have not completed the review. I am logged in as the administrator. Yet, I still receive an error. I have also checked the log file and there is no associated error near the call:

2014-06-24 15:52:37,446 DEBUG [qtp1945055206-722 ] fisheye ProfilingServletFilter-logRequest - start request GET /rest-service/reviews-v1/FSI-7/remind sessionid=5hvi9r9g6b5s1swy40o9t1w3e
2014-06-24 15:52:37,463 DEBUG [qtp1945055206-722 ] fisheye ProfilingServletFilter-logRequest - end request in 17ms GET /rest-service/reviews-v1/FSI-7/remind sessionid=5hvi9r9g6b5s1swy40o9t1w3e 500

I have attached a .txt file with the xml results of the query.
fields.summary: Remind REST API Call issue

fields.description:
Few issues with REST endpoint {{/rest-service/reviews-v1/\{reviewid\}/remind}}:
 * incomplete documentation: https://docs.atlassian.com/fisheye-crucible/latest/wadl/crucible.html#rest-service:reviews-v1:id:remind  - it doesn't explain how the request should be structured and what details are returned in the response
 * recipients list must be provided in the request.  Lack of them causes NPE, see below.
 * intention of this endpoint is to send reminders to incomplete participants, so recipients parameter should be optional.  Lack of parameter should result in all incomplete reviewers being notified
 * -UI accepts email addresses too, perhaps same should be allowed in the REST call?- actually not, this endpoint sends email to incomplete participants, it would make no sense to accept email address. https://docs.atlassian.com/fisheye-crucible/latest/wadl/fecru.html#rest-service-fecru:share-content-v1:share should be used in such case

At the moment, sending a message with no recipients causes NPE:
{noformat}
2015-01-28 20:03:30,218 ERROR [qtp1707903278-783 ] fisheye ExceptionLoggerUtil-logError - Exception thrown during REST request:null User: null Referrer:null
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.atlassian.crucible.spi.impl.DefaultReviewService$37.doInTransaction(DefaultReviewService.java:2495)
        at com.atlassian.crucible.spi.impl.DefaultReviewService$37.doInTransaction(DefaultReviewService.java:2482)
        at com.atlassian.fisheye.spi.impl.DefaultTxTemplate.execute(DefaultTxTemplate.java:76)
        at com.atlassian.crucible.spi.impl.DefaultReviewService.remindIncompleteReviewers(DefaultReviewService.java:2482)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        ...
        at $Proxy185.remindIncompleteReviewers(Unknown Source)
        at com.atlassian.fecrurestplugin.crucible.RestReviewService.remindIncompleteReviewers(RestReviewService.java:1944)
{noformat}

providing list of usernames in recipients field allows to send notifications, list of users who were found in the system and were sent a message is returned in the response.  E.g. having {{/tmp/remind.xml}} file:
{code:xml}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<remindMessage>
    <message>Reminder message text.</message>
    <recipients>pswiecicki</recipients>
    <recipients>test</recipients>
</remindMessage>
{code}

one can send reminder with:
{code}
curl -H "Content-Type: application/xml" --user $USER:$PASS --data @/tmp/remind.xml http://FISHEYE_HOST/rest-service/reviews-v1/<REVIEW_PERM_ID>/remind
{code}
fields.summary: Remind REST API Issue

fields.description:
Git repos consider any commits merged to a branch to be on the branch, so a feature branch which has had master merged to it will show all the merged changesets from master in the add content dialog, even though a branch filter is in place.

This makes it hard to choose all the changesets for the branch -- they may be many pages back.

A workaround is to filter by an issue id in the commit messages.

It would be better for the filter to show changesets which are *only* on the filtered branch.
fields.summary: Filtering by branch in the add content dialog works poorly for git repos

fields.description:
Using Firefox:
1. View a file in Crucible that is longer than the screen in the pane on the right
2. Search for a phrase in the file (Ctrl+F)
3. The search "finds" the phrase, but does not focus on it

-Note this behavior is relatively new and didn't happen a couple months ago (not sure at which version it changed)
-This isn't a problem in Chrome
fields.summary: Searching in Firefox change focus

fields.description:
Somehow, its possible to add Merge Commit into review now https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FE-4004
However, the merge commit in branches other than master will produce duplicate files.

h3.Steps to reproduce
# Let's start with branch master
# Create and checkout new branch ("feature")
# Commit changes in 'test.txt" file - "Changes in feature"
# Checkout master branch
# Commit changes in 'test.txt' file - "Changes in master"
# Checkout feature branch
# Merge changes from master into feature branch
# Fix the conflict and commit changes in 'test.txt' file - "Merge commit"
# Add the commits from steps 3 and 8 (both in feature branch) into a review
Duplicate files 'test.txt' appear in the review
# Checkout master branch
# Create a new brach ("feature2") only, no need to checkout
# Commit changes in 'test2.txt" file - "Changes in master"
# Checkout feature2 branch
# Commit changes in 'test2.txt' file - "Changes in feature2"
# Checkout master branch
# Merge changes from feature2 into master branch
# Fix the conflict and commit changes in 'test2.txt' file - "Merge commit 2"
# Add the commits from steps 12 and 17 (both in master branch) into a review
This does not produce duplicate file 'test2.txt'
fields.summary: Adding Git Merge commit will have duplicate files

fields.description:
*Given*
Reviewers have completed a *pre-commit review*

*When*
Author of a pre-commit review adds more content to the review via patch

*Then*
The reviewers' statuses aren't changed. Their statuses remain as Completed and they still have the tick on their avatars.

+Note+
The issues is reproducible for pre-commit reviews only. It works fine for post-commit reviews and even when author adds changes via "browse changesets" to pre-commit review it changes the statuses.

+Work around+
Add a comment and mark it as Defect
fields.summary: The reviewers' statuses are not changed, when adding new content to a pre-commit review

fields.description: We have a user that is requesting that the defect classifications be available on a per project basis and not a global system setting.
fields.summary: change the defect classifications
Korean Characters On Review Comments Displayed As Question Mark When External Database (mySQL) Is Used

fields.description: If an error occurs with the CLI Tool, just the HTTP response code is returned to the user. It would be helpful to include more information if the response from the API includes an error message. Creating a review with the CLI Tool and a title greater than 255 characters results in the following error which provides no indication of why this is a bad request: {noformat}crucible.py CR --title "Sample text to get over 255 characters. Sample text to get over 255 characters. Sample text to get over 255 characters. Sample text to get over 255 characters. Sample text to get over 255 characters. Sample text to get over 255 characters. Sample text to get over 255 characters." Received an unexpected response HTTP Error 400: Bad Request. Please check that http://:8060 is a Crucible server{noformat} But, if trying to create a review with a title greater than 255 characters, the REST API returns the following error response: *HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request* {noformat}IllegalArgumentThe value 'HD-17399 HC2 only - Crash was becuase of stale reference of unit object in the port object after maincard get deleted. This is only applicable to HC2 becuase of not having BCM on line cards.Solution was not to use the unit_obj reference in port object, rather use the mainboard's unit_obj. read comment section' for the property 'name' is too long. It should have a maximum length of 255java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: The value 'HD-17399 HC2 only - Crash was becuase of stale reference of unit object in the port object after maincard get deleted. This is only applicable to HC2 becuase of not having BCM on line cards.Solution was not to use the unit_obj reference in port object, rather use the mainboard's unit_obj. read comment section' for the property 'name' is too long. It should have a maximum length of 255 at com.cenqua.crucible.hibernate.PropertyLengthCheckerListener.checkEntity(PropertyLengthCheckerListener.java:25) ...{noformat}
fields.summary: CLI Tool should provide better error messages if present in the API response

fields.description:
Some times, we want few persons to be notified, when the comment is made by reviewer or On Review creation and closing activity etc. These members are not exactly Reviewers.

Currently there is no option to do this. Hence we make them as Reviewers. If we have this feature it would be really good
fields.summary: Marking some members as followers instead of Reviewers

fields.description:
When attempting to complete review as a reviewer, Crucible would prompt the reviewer if there are any draft comments left on the review or if any files on the reviews were not read yet.  User is presented options: View/Delete/Post drafts or Click here to view the unreviewed file, accordingly.

But clicking on View drafts/Click here to view the unreviewed file just adds appropriate criteria to the view filter, without unsetting filters already set.  This lead to a scenario:
 # I am reviewer, have one draft comment on a file and another unread file on review
 # I pick up complete review option, see a prompt that there are draft comments
 # I click "view drafts" link and can easily see which file there is a draft comment on
 # I go to the draft comment and delete it.
 # I try to complete review again, see a prompt that there is unread file on review
 # I click  Click here to view the unreviewed file link.  But all the files are greyed out because the filter is set to show files which are both unread and have draft comments.  There are no such files.

The prompts should unset all preselected filters before adding new criteria to the filter.
fields.summary: Crucible prompt to show outstanding draft/unread files doesn't reset the filter

fields.description:
Good Morning,
Since a few weeks we are not able to see commits out of JIRA, it seems to be a problem with the authorization between JIRA anc Crucible & Fisheye.
We are using: JIRA V6.2.5 and FishEye & Crucible 3.4.4

On the screenshots you can see the errors:

bug1.png: The message we got when we try to see our commits on a JIRA task.

bug2.png: This is the window we get when clicking on the "commits" link in our JIRA.

bug3.png: The  Authorization to crucible we get.

bug4. png: Profile settings, you can see that the Authorization was successfull. But at this point we still get the error message from bug1.png. It's an endless circle.

Can someone confirm this as a bug?
Our administrator send me here, he told me there is nothing he can do about it.

Thanks Folks!

Kind regards,
Aleks
fields.summary: Authorization with JIRA fails, cannot see commits

fields.description: Support for workflows where I’d like to set a “mandatory” and “optional” reviewers. Review doesn’t get closed unless all mandatory (or one?) reviewers have finished. Additionaly, I may not wish to wait for optional reviewers. “Due Time” could be used to close the review if workflow is set that way. I’m using it now only to signal my wish. However sometimes I’d like to be more strict about it.
fields.summary: Support "optional" and "mandatory" reviewers

fields.description: Right now as a reviewer I'm only given an option to either complete the review or mark defects in the review. However I'd like to have an explicit "Reject" button to signal that the approach is wrong. This will support workflows with a "Rejected" state where we integrate Crucible with our ticketing system.
fields.summary: Provide a "Reject" option for reviewers

fields.description: There is a common practice in my team to add multiple reviewers, however with different expectations - "mandatory" reviewers need to participate and review, whereas "optional" reviewers are invited as sort of FYI only. As an optional reviewer, or even if I believe I cannot contribute to the review, I'd like to have the possibility to Leave the review.
fields.summary: Provide a reviewer with "Leave" option

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
1) Create review and add attached patches
2) Make sure your browser window height is about 750px
3) Click on "remote_test_node.go" file 
4) Click on "Prefs" and select "Side-by-side Diffs"
5) Select file "zulti_node_kill_all_and_recovery_test.go"
6) Click on "remote_test_node.go" again but this time switch diff mode to "Unified Diffs" by "Prefs" menu
7) Try to scroll down to the bottom of the file

*Result*
You can't see end of file

*Expected* 
But you should :)
fields.summary: Losing page scroll height upon switching diff mode in review preferences

fields.description: If would be awesome to be able to define a top-level project and then a "sub-project" or "development area" within that project that has the list of default reviewers associated with it. As it stands we have to create and manage multiple projects or have each developer manually selected as reviewers.
fields.summary: Sub Projects for Crucible

fields.description: We are reviewing our budgets for this year and planning for next year. How do we determine, track, monitor, report (or whatever method is available), how many concurrent user licenses we are using?
fields.summary: How do we know what our license usage is?

fields.description:
If the content at /var/data/uploads (i.e. /var/data/uploads/xx/yy/zz.dat) is missing, the review content coming from uploaded patches and attachments can't be viewed, and an error message is showed. Content coming from the repository can still be viewed if the repository is accessible.

The suggestion is to let the user know what content is missing, in a way that allows the user to re-upload the content.

Log shows:
{noformat}
2014-06-02 17:12:46,510 WARN  [qtp1284205043-221 ] org.eclipse.jetty.servlet.ServletHandler ServletHandler-doHandle - 
javax.servlet.ServletException: javax.el.ELException: java.io.FileNotFoundException: /Users/grefosco/Documents/Atlassian/FishEye/fecru-3.4.0/var/data/uploads/00/00/20.dat (No such file or directory)
{noformat}

*WORKAROUND*
There is actually no way to recover patches and attachments content unless you have a backup of FishEye information. You can, however, keep working with the review and re-upload the missing files by doing the following:
# Re-create the missing .dat file (i.e. if the error says *java.io.FileNotFoundException: /Users/grefosco/Documents/Atlassian/FishEye/fecru-3.4.0/var/data/uploads/00/00/21.dat (No such file or directory)* then navigate to {{/Users/grefosco/Documents/Atlassian/FishEye/fecru-3.4.0/var/data/uploads/00/00}} and create a file named {{21.dat}}
# Open the review (no errors will be thrown if you re-created all the .dat files associated with this review).
# Delete and re-add all the patch/attachment content that is missing.
fields.summary: Can't view review content if files at /var/data/uploads are missing

fields.description:
If I opt not to create a review the first time I view the Create Review links in the development section, I do not get another opportunity.

Reproduction Steps:
1) Load up a JIRA ticket that has had some development done on it.
2) Click on the "4 commits" link under the development section
3) Note that in the "Files" column there are links next to each commit that read "Create Review"
4) Rather than clicking those links, click the Commit number and view the Fisheye diff.
5) Click back.  The Create Review links are no longer there.
fields.summary: Create Review Links Disappearing

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Access a review with a larger monitor (2560x1600)
# Add a revision that have a file around 100 lines
# Set the View to be 100 lines
# Add two inline comments with around 50 lines in between
# Use the shortcut key 'J' and 'K' to jump back and forth between those two comments 
# Repeat step 5 non-stop
Sometimes it does not jump to the comment but to the lines in between the comments

*Edit:*

This _may not_ be related to resolution of the screen. Further testing on this will also result in very intermittent output on a 1280x1024 screen.

Tested with two revision. CR-1 contains a file that has multiple commits (diff) and CR-2 contains a file that only have one commit (file addition). These both files contain 200 lines.

* On CR-1, I was able to easily reproduce this problem where the scrolling stopped between next element (with an in-line comment every 50 lines).
* However, on CR-2, it is slightly more difficult to reproduce the problem. Nevertheless, the problem with moving elements forward and backwards exist occasionally. 

Currently it also affects the latest Chrome Version 42.0.2311.152 m on FishEye/Crucible 3.8
fields.summary: Prev/Next element not working correctly in big screen intermittently

fields.description:
HTR:

# Create a new review
# At the Add Content screen, select any option (ie. Browse Changesets)
# At this point the screen stays with a gray overlay but no box is displayed to select changesets

Error thrown by IE9:

{{Line: 860 Error: Unable to get value of the property 'style': object is null or undefined}}

IE9 version 9.0.8112.16421
fields.summary: Add content fails to render in IE9

fields.description:
The *Share* button is currently used to send notifications to reviewers that have not yet completed their review when the review is not overdue, as described at [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Using+Review+Reminders]. The term is quite confuse, as it seems this button would serve to share the review with people that is not a participant.

The suggestion is to change the text of the button to *Send Reminder*, as this is actually its purpose.
fields.summary: In a review, change name of the button from "Share" to "Send Reminder"

fields.description:
Currently it is only possible to set a reminder for 1 day before the review is due. However some reviews are more urgent, and are set to be due in less than a day. The suggestion is to allow the reminder to be set in this case.

For instance, if it is 3 PM and I create a review marked to be due at 10 AM of the next day, I can't set a reminder for it.
fields.summary: Allow to set a reminder for a review to be due in less than a day

fields.description: The suggestion is to add missing types to Crucible XSD schema, like the type {{reviews}}, so review information can be unmarshalled with JAXB.
fields.summary: Add missing types to Crucible XSD schema

fields.description: When an item is searched for in the review page, and not found, the response page appears to users as if the search function has crashed. I've received several emails about this. Can we make that 'resource not found' page look a little more like not found instead of a search function crash.
fields.summary: Misleading response page

fields.description: As in title. "Browse changeset" dialog does not appear at all.
fields.summary: IE9 - Review "browse changeset" dialog does not appear

fields.description:
* JIRA 6.2.3
* FishEye/Crucible 3.4.4
* Both running in localhost, no proxy, no firewall, etc.
* OAuth authentication configured in both sides.
* Internet Explorer 9

I browse to a JIRA issue and in the Development tab I click on "X commits" link. The list of revisions associated with that issue is displayed. To the right of one of the revisions, I click on "Create Review" action and this is displayed:
!Capture.PNG!

This does not happen in Google Chrome nor in Mozilla Firefox.
I could not find any errors in JIRA logs nor in FishEye/Crucible logs.
fields.summary: Crucible project list not displayed when creating review from JIRA using IE9

fields.description:
!http://i.imgur.com/RLZ4HnV.png!

but:

!http://i.imgur.com/6l6OKVf.png!

Same with Rejected - renders as Abandoned
fields.summary: Reviews in approval state render as Draft in the review header

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Create two Crucible project: ProjectA and ProjectB
# Create a group GroupA with member 'UserA'
# Set GroupA as the Allowed review participants for ProjectA
# Create a review in ProjectB without any reviewer
# Migrate the review in ProjectB to ProjectA
Unable to migrate to review to ProjectA with the following error in the log:
{noformat}
2014-05-21 18:29:21,614 WARN  [qtp1498068251-146 ] org.eclipse.jetty.servlet.ServletHandler ServletHandler-doHandle - /json/cru/asdf-2/postDetails
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.cenqua.crucible.model.managers.impl.DefaultProjectManager.isAllowedReviewer(DefaultProjectManager.java:426)
	at com.cenqua.crucible.model.managers.impl.DefaultProjectManager.moveReviewInternal(DefaultProjectManager.java:304)
	at com.cenqua.crucible.model.managers.impl.DefaultProjectManager.moveReviewToProject(DefaultProjectManager.java:288)
	at com.atlassian.crucible.actions.create.EditReviewDetailsAction.execute(EditReviewDetailsAction.java:397)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
Remove all the group in Allowed review participants before migrating the review
fields.summary: Unable to migrate review to different project due to Project Allowed Reviewer Group

fields.description: A patch containing the euro symbol or pound sign as a sequence of UTF-8 bytes will not be correctly displayed -- the characters will appear as a sequence of incorrect characters rather than a single symbol.
fields.summary: UTF-8 patches are not correctly displayed

fields.description:
Not sure if this should be against JIRA or Crucible, as it relates to the integration between the two:
JIRA Version: v6.2.1
JIRA Fisheye plugin: v6.2.10

I have a custom JIRA workflow which includes applying the following condition when transitioning to the Closed state:
- This transition will only execute if there are no unreviewed changesets related to this issue

If I have a changeset included in a review, but abandon that review, I can still transition the JIRA state to Closed, even though the commit shows no reviews in the Fisheye/Crucible Development tab.

Deleting the review object removes the Close button, so it seems that Abandoned reviews are counted for changesets being reviewed, but not included when displaying reviews against a changeset.

I feel like Abandoned reviews should be ignored completely with this check.
fields.summary: Abandoned reviews are included when applying a workflow transition for unreviewed changesets

fields.description: The suggestion is to be able to export (as PDF, CSV, Excel, etc) the reviews list presented in the Review Dashboard. Attached is a screenshot of the Review Dashboard for which the suggestion should apply.
fields.summary: Ability to export results from Review Dashboard

fields.description:
My suggestion is based in the fact that if a user tries to link a JIRA issue in a Crucible review, and the *Accept remote API calls* option in JIRA is OFF, nothing happens (no errors, no indication of what happened in the UI), the *Link* button just does nothing.

The documentation about integration between JIRA and FishEye is actually clear about enabling this option, but in case it is not, an indication in the logs might be helpful to identify this, or maybe even a message suggesting to review the documentation in case no link is created.
fields.summary: Indicate in FishEye logs when "Accept remote API calls" option in JIRA is OFF

fields.description:
I'm using svn 1.7 and have a problem with visualisation of Cyrillic characters for the new scripts when creating review with pre-commit patch

1. I'm creating patch, which contains new scripts, which till haven't been added to repository. This scripts displays in patch like this

--- DataBase/SuperJetConfo/Procedure/dbo.pSwiftHistoryView.sql	(revision 0)
+++ DataBase/SuperJetConfo/Procedure/dbo.pSwiftHistoryView.sql	(working copy)

2. I'm loading this patch to crucible issue. Loading is correct but Cyrillic symbols displays incorrect, despite of my repository encoding (windows-1251). (example on picture incorrect_codifier.jpg)

If I change the revision of script in patch file like this 

--- DataBase/SuperJetConfo/Procedure/dbo.pSwiftHistoryView.sql	(revision 1)
+++ DataBase/SuperJetConfo/Procedure/dbo.pSwiftHistoryView.sql	(working copy)

Codifier loads correctly (correct_codifier.jpg), but script couldn't be anchored

How I can solve this problem, could you help me ?
fields.summary: Incorrect visualisation of Cyrillic characters for the new scripts (which haven't been added to the repository)

fields.description:
The defect list should include all the defects, the status of the defects (see CRUC-6812) and the name of the person who wrote the defects.

As it is now you can get some of that info in the "Advanced Search", but it's not a good solution. You have to click at least twice and insert the search criteria. It will never be done due to that it's too much work. I think that Crucible should be much easier to use with some kind of defect list. Please have a look at your competitor Smart Bear's tool Collaborator, who have a nice defect list and a good way of presenting the info. They also have a "defect fixed" solution.
http://smartbear.com/products/software-development/code-review/
fields.summary: Defects presented in a list in the "Details" view

fields.description:
I heard from your support that this is coming in the future, but I'm adding this feature request just to indicate that this is extremely important for us. In fact this is what's stopping us from choosing Crucible today!

I have described the issue here:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/293658/mark-a-defect-as-handled-fixed#

The short story is that it has to be possible to change status of the defects depending on if the defect has been handled by the author, fix checked by the reviewer, defect rejected by the author and so on.

The possibility for the reviewer to set "defect-fixed" should of course only be available for the defects placed by just that reviewer. If a "defect-fixed" solution isn't available the author/moderator doesn't know that the reviewer(s) has checked all updates. "Completed" only says that the reviewer has checked something.

Defects rejected by the author should not be counted in the statistics!
fields.summary: Add status of defects

fields.description:
1.) Start a review with a number of reviewers.
2.) Complete one/several reviewers.
3.) Decoration is set to "completed".
4.) The author adds more content or a new defect is added by any of the reviewers (the decoration is changed by any of these two scenarios).
5.) When a reviewer makes the browser active the updates are discovered and decoration is changed. Press 'Review updated: Reload'.
6.) Decoration of the completed reviewers is changed from the "completed" decoration to a green line below the reviewer's picture. Still 100% reviewed and complete.
7.) Reviewer reloads the webpage by reloading the browser.
8.) Decoration is changed to a red line and the completeness is 0%. This seems to be wrong!
fields.summary: Reloading webpage drops decoration

fields.description:
An unauthenticated user is able to set the admin password of Crucible to any value, gaining admin access to the Crucible instance as a result.

The vulnerability affects Crucible version 3.x. Versions earlier than 3.0 are not vulnerable. The vulnerability has been fixed in recent releases 3.0.4, 3.1.7, 3.2.5, 3.3.4, 3.4.4, 3.5.0.

For additional details see the [full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/FishEye+and+Crucible+Security+Advisory+2014-05-21].
fields.summary: Administrator password reset

fields.description:
Given: some reviewers have completed the review

When: add more content to the review using the Add content dialog and close the dialog

Problem: the reviewers are not refreshed, as the finished reviewers still have the tick on their avatars.
fields.summary: The reviewers are not refreshed, when adding new content to a review

fields.description:
Right now you can see only 3 buttons on review screen, f.e. 'Edit details', 'Uncomplete', 'Tools' menu.

!screen_1.jpg!

I'd like to get possibility to configure to show more buttons, which by default are 'hidden' in Tools menu.
It can be configured the same way as number of buttons for workflow actions in Jira (in properties file)
fields.summary: Enable to show more buttons on review screen

fields.description:
See example git repository: https://bitbucket.org/pswiecicki/cruc-6806-dup-files-on-review-no-common-ancestry with the following ancestry tree (typical diamond problem):
{noformat}
$ git log --graph   --oneline
* f5ee7b6 added master
* 31b6c4d added master
* f90b59e added master
*   fd84373 Merge branch 'branchRight'
|\
| * 16dcba6 added right
| * 7f58924 added right
| * e04882e added right
* | 1efa376 added left 3rd
* | 1ee5e72 added left 2nd
* | 8c60043 added left 1st
|/
* 55b80b9 on master
{noformat}
(each commits modifies single file.txt file)
When creating review for changesets 1ee5e72 (middle commit on branchLeft), 7f58924 (middle commit on branchRight) and f90b59e (merged master) Crucible end up showing two separate files on review, see 
!https://monosnap.com/image/Em356QygZFbUU5eP8QqJoEmyHQ2xV5.png!

This seem to confuse Crucible users, they consider this as a bug, in fact it seems related to CRUC-6568 but it is not.

We could think of a way to improve this.  Few options:
 * continue to show files separate but make it explicit that they come from different branches
 * stop adding same file more than once, find youngest common ancestor and add it to the review (there should always be one for typical repositories with single commit graph).  Perhaps also find oldest common descendant and add it too, if there is one.  But this brings problem how to show this if there is no common descendant yet.  users expects the rightmost version on file revision slider is the most recent version of the file, but there is no really newer/older relation between commits of no common descendant.
 * stop adding same file more than once, visualise linear version slider as commit graph?  Seems weird and unnecessarily overcomplicated
fields.summary: files from different ancestry lines shown as duplicates

fields.description:
See this CAC page comment:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/review+duration?focusedCommentId=592281652#comment-592281652
fields.summary: Enable "review duration" to use other time units such as "hour"

fields.description: The Review Dashboard has the ability to filter reviews based on criteria like the title, project, status, etc. It would be really nice if it were also possible to filter based on a date range; for example, we have people in our QA department who would like to be able to get statistics such as how many reviews were created in any given two-week period.
fields.summary: Review Dashboard filter.

fields.description:
Currently, the reviews created by [Automatic Review Creator|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.plugins.reviewcreator] are in Draft state.

It will be better if it can detect Project Default Reviewers setting and automatically change the Review state to be Open.
fields.summary: Automatic Review Creator: If Project Default Reviewer is set, automatically set the review to be in Open state

fields.description:
Currently, all the commits pushed to any branches will be created as a review: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.plugins.reviewcreator

It would be better to have a setting to choose which branches to create the review.
fields.summary: Automatic Review Creator: Ability to choose which repository branches to have automatic review created

fields.description:
When using the comment search functionality in Crucible, specifying 'after' and 'before' dates, the search is performed, but an error pops up for a second reporting:

{noformat}
Error
Could not parse start date 2014-01-01T00:00:00

Error 2
Could not parse end date 2014-01-02T23:59:59
{noformat}

As of functionality, the search works, so it seems to be a UI error only. The application logs show nothing.
fields.summary: Could not parse start date error when searching for comments

fields.description:
CLI tool deletes the last new line character from patch.
To reproduce
1. upload hg patch which ends with '\n' character by CLI.
2. Download it from crucible WEB UI. 
3. Compare (The last line of patch won't end with '\n')

I used Windows 7 and Python 2.7.3
fields.summary: CLI tool deletes the last new line character from patch.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The Crucible and JIRA integration does not support the JIRA Subtasks, only JIRA Tasks can be created from a Crucible Review.

h3. Suggested Solution
The following use cases may be considered.

+A Crucible review is linked to a JIRA Task+
When creating an issue from the Crucible review comment, I want to create a new JIRA Task or a Subtask.

+A Crucible review is linked to a JIRA Subtask+
When creating an issue from the Crucible review comment, I want to create a new JIRA Subtask having as parent the same JIRA Task of the already linked Subtask.

 
h3. Workaround 
Create the Subtask in JIRA and, after is has been created, link it to the Crucible review.
fields.summary: As a user, I want to create a JIRA Substask from a Crucible Review instead of an issue

fields.description:
If the referrer header is manipulated and an error condition is triggered, the user will be displayed the error page in FeCru, which includes the manipulated referrer value on the page as a link.  The use of the referrer header value directly as the target of a hyperlink can result in the user unknowingly executing code on the target system.

Reproducing this condition can be accomplished using a crafted request such as as the one below:

GET /download/ HTTP/1.1
X-AUSERNAME: gsrobert
Referer: javascript:prompt(936711);
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko)
Chrome/28.0.1500.63 Safari/537.36
Host: crucible-test.ksc.nasa.gov
Connection: Keep-alive
Accept-Encoding: gzip,deflate
Acunetix-Product: WVS/9.0 (Acunetix Web Vulnerability Scanner - NORMAL)
Acunetix-Scanning-agreement: Third Party Scanning PROHIBITED
fields.summary: Use of the referrer header on the error page for Crucible can enable XSS attacks

fields.description:
Hello.

   Planning an upgrade to crucible tonight and wondering if there were any know issues upgrading version 2.9.2 to 3.4.0.

    Specifically wondering if it was recommended going to another version first before going to 3.4.0

Details:  Running on debian, postgres 8.4
fields.summary: Question Regarding Upgrading 2.9.2 to 3.4.0

fields.description:
Currently repository and branch autocomplete dropdown lists are truncated at 50. 

Please make this number configurable by administrators.
fields.summary: Configurable limit of autocomplete dropdowns

fields.description:
It would be nice to have the following features implemented:-
When all reviewers completes a review, it is closed automatically without moderator role. At the same time, an Author cannot close review without all reviewers completing the review.
fields.summary: Auto Close / Close Review When Only All Reviewers Completes Review

fields.description:
CRU_REVIEW has a cru_metrics_version field which is expected to be a non-null integer.
The field is populated when creating a review, with the highest metrics version (from cru_metrics_version). This in turn starts out empty and is pre-populated from default-metrics-config.xml in FISHEYE_HOME. If the file doesn't exist or is malformed, reviews with null cru_metrics_version are created, causing subsequent NPEs on code paths expecting the field to not be null.

* verify and improve robustness of the default import (couldn't it just come with data.sql/upgrade task)?
* fix error handling if the metrics version is not resolved correctly (should throw and prevent creating broken reviews)
fields.summary: Make default metrics handling more robust
Review Reminder doesn't Email message text (also change templated subject line)

fields.description:
I would like the System Analyst, Junior Developer and Tester that I work with to see and follow crucible reviews. Currently I add them as 'Reviewers' however I would much prefer if they could be included as a viewers rather than reviewers. There is an expectation that reviewers mark their review as complete which I do not need/want for viewers. I just want my SA, Junior developer and QA to see the artefacts in the review and be notified when comments are added or an actual reviewer completes their review. Allowing them to add comments would be nice but not essential.
I know that I could send them a link to the review but having them visible on the review as ‘parties involved’ would be more convenient.
fields.summary: Requesting observer role

fields.description:
Currently Crucible will automatically send reviewers a reminder email one working day before the deadline. Preset reminders can also be configured to send a reminder to all of the pending reviewers some number of working days before the deadline, but this must be configured for each review individually. (Retrieved from [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Using+Review+Reminders].)

It would be great if it were possible to configure a batch process to run on a hourly/daily/weekly/monthly basis (Cron expression?) at Project level, instead of at Review level, to send reminder notifications to all or to specific   participants at once, for all outstanding reviews.
fields.summary: Add a scheduled batch process to send notifications

fields.description:
It would be great if there were a way to "like" (or "agree with") a comment to provide a compact way to move a debate about the code towards consensus. Then users could "like" a comment without having to reply to it with another comment that says "agree" or "good point" which adds value to the debate, but clutters the thread.

I imagine this feature implemented as a little plus or thumbs-up icon in the corner of the comment bubble with a number next to it showing how many people have liked it. Then if you hover your cursor over it, a little dialog pops-up with the list of people who have liked the comment. You should also be able to unlike the comment so that if you're persuaded by a later comment you can change your vote.
fields.summary: Add a "Like" Button for Comments
Support for Python syntax highlighting in Crucible review comments
Mail Notification - Revert changes in the email subject

fields.description:
In FishEye/Crucible 3.3.1 the user creation fails when Crucible license limit reached. Meanwhile in FishEye/Crucible 3.2.0 new user can be created even when the Crucible license limit is reached. On both the versions mentioned, the FishEye license is unlimited or more than the Crucible license limit.

Steps to reproduce: Try adding new user in the FishEye/Crucible when the Crucible license limit is reached. 

The following information is found in the log:-
{noformat}
2014-04-15 12:20:05,889 WARN  - Newly-added user "xxxxxx" could not be made a
 Crucible user:You have reached your maximum of 50 Crucible users.
2014-04-15 12:20:05,954 WARN  - Rolled back transaction
{noformat}


Note: Synchronising user from JIRA/Crowd will also fail due to this mentioned issue.
fields.summary: User creation fails due to license limit in crucible

fields.description:
Crucible shows a message "Cannot perform the requested action" while creating a review and selecting changesets related to the same file if the changesets are selected in a specific order.

In order to reproduce this, I performed 4 commits, changing the same file 4 times, then I created a review and selected the changesets in the following order (screenshots attached to help explaining it):
# Select changeset 58
# Select changeset 57
# Select changeset 55 (notice the jump of 1 changeset)
# Try selecting the changeset 56

* {{selecttest}} is the name of the file

If the changesets are selected in order (from 58 to 55 without jumping) or for instance from 55 to 58, this does not happen. Also it does not seem to be related to the SCM used (tested with SVN, Git and Perforce).

Attachments:
* atlassian-fisheye-2014-04-14.log
* select1.png
* select2.png (when I select the changeset 56)
fields.summary: "Cannot perform the requested action" when selecting changesets for same file depending on the selection order

fields.description:
Text file which contains character code >127 is treated as binary files when it's added to review using REST addFile. That causes  "Download revision ..". link to appear instead of text to be displayed.

As workaround file content type 'text/plain' can provided during file upload. Which means instead of {code}curl -v http://localhost:6060/foo/rest-service/reviews-v1/CR-1/addFile -u user:password -F "file=@CU94745.CBL"{code} we can use {code}curl -v http://localhost:6060/foo/rest-service/reviews-v1/CR-1/addFile -u user:password -F "file=@CU94745.CBL;type=text/plain"{code}. Note {{;type=text/plain}} difference.
fields.summary: Text file detected as binary when using REST addFile

fields.description:
When connection pool is empty then next thread requesting a connection waits for ever (Integer.MAX_VALUE milliseconds) to get the connection. It may lead to deadlocks:
{code:java}
"btpool0-16456" prio=10 tid=0x00007f62387b2800 nid=0x6448 waiting on condition [0x00007f6251417000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: TIMED_WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x0000000681416d58> (a com.jolbox.bonecp.BoundedLinkedTransferQueue)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.parkNanos(LockSupport.java:226)
	at jsr166y.LinkedTransferQueue.awaitMatch(LinkedTransferQueue.java:691)
	at jsr166y.LinkedTransferQueue.xfer(LinkedTransferQueue.java:600)
	at jsr166y.LinkedTransferQueue.poll(LinkedTransferQueue.java:1068)
	at com.jolbox.bonecp.BoundedLinkedTransferQueue.poll(BoundedLinkedTransferQueue.java:78)
	at com.jolbox.bonecp.BoneCP.getConnection(BoneCP.java:500)
	at com.jolbox.bonecp.provider.BoneCPConnectionProvider.getConnection(BoneCPConnectionProvider.java:180)
	at org.hibernate.jdbc.ConnectionManager.openConnection(ConnectionManager.java:446)
	at org.hibernate.jdbc.ConnectionManager.getConnection(ConnectionManager.java:167)
	at org.hibernate.jdbc.AbstractBatcher.prepareQueryStatement(AbstractBatcher.java:161)
{code}
To make application more self healing sane timeout (60 secs) should be introduced for retrieving connection from pool.
h1. Workaround

Timeout can be set manually in config.xml:
{code:java}
...
<database ...>
        ...
        <parameters>
bonecp.connectionTimeoutInMs=60000
        </parameters>
</database
{code}
fields.summary: Set database connection pool timeout

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Add a reviewer (eg: test) to a review through UI
# Make sure that there is an email sent to the reviewer 'test'
# Remove the reviewer 'test' through UI
# Add the reviewer again through REST:
{noformat}
curl -u admin:admin -X POST --data "test" -H "Content-Type: application/xml" http://localhost:8060/rest-service/reviews-v1/CR-6/reviewers
{noformat}
# Make sure that the reviewer is added by checking the review through UI
No email notification is sent for adding reviewer through REST
fields.summary: Notification email not sent when adding reviewer through REST

fields.description: Trying to reproduce this issue: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CRUC-6600 ... Everything appears fine with this.
fields.summary: TEST please ignore Trying to reproduce this issue: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CRUC-6600 ....
links to JIRA issues and Crucible reviews rendered incorrectly

fields.description:
I work on a large project so I am assigned to dozens of reviews every day. I only review a few of these, but my Crucible inbox has become huge and unmanageable. I don't want to mark the other reviews as "Complete", so the only way I can trim down my inbox is to click "Edit Details" for each individual review and remove myself from it. This is a tedious and time-consuming process.

Since the Crucible inbox resembles an email inbox, I think there should be a way to select reviews from the list and immediately remove myself from them. Or, barring that, there should be a "Remove Me" link under a review's "Tools" menu.
fields.summary: Add a way to quickly remove myself from reviews

fields.description:
The default criteria are simply that all Reviewers have hit the "Complete" button.  

I'd like to be able to require that all Defects have had a custom Classification called "Status" set to certain values.  As it is currently, I have to use Advanced Crucible Search to manually verify each defect has an allowed Classification value and manually notify each Reviewer if they missed one.
fields.summary: Need a way to set custom criteria for identifying when reviews are ready to close

fields.description:
Due to the bug https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=407817  the native search (aka. finding text on page) in firefox doesn't work properly.

Given: a page with a term "blabla" at the bottom of the page
When: the user is viewing the top of the page, and try to search for "blabla"
Expected: the page should scroll to the term "blabla" at the bottom and have the word highlighted.
Actual: in firefox, the page doesn't scroll properly

NOTE: IE, chrome, safari handle the native search correctly.

WORKAROUND: use another browser for now, as this issue is being still investigated.
fields.summary: Problem with finding text using (cmd+f/ctrl+f) in firefox in FishEye and Crucible

fields.description:
Currently it is possible to add multiple repositories to a Crucible project when there is a FishEye license present. For a Crucible license only, that option is not there.

It would be nice if this was possible for a single Crucible license.

*Workaround #1*
The current workaround is to have a FishEye license (can be an evaluation) to add multiple repositories which will still prevail once the FishEye license is either removed or expired.

*Workaround #2*
Visit the URL {{<FISHEYE-SITE-URL>/admin/viewFisheyeProject.do?id=<PROJECT-NUMERIC-ID>}} and add the repositories from the UI as normal.
fields.summary: Allow Multiple Repositories For a Single Project With a Crucible License Only

fields.description: Having the manage admin and groups screens show user display names would make these screens much easier to use.
fields.summary: Show user display name along with user ID in manage admin and groups screens

fields.description:
Yesterday our Crucible threw the following error:
{code}
Repository index failed due to error com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryClientExoeption: 
com.atlassian.fisheye.dvcs.handler.DvcsProcessException: Error while communicating with VCS: 
com.atlassian.fisheye.dvcs.handler.DvcsProcessException: Error while communicating with VCS: 
com.atlassian.utils.process.ProcessException: While executing: "git whatchanged --always --reverse --date-order -m ‐-no-abbrev -C --find-copies-harder 5e2ebe6a0aa239635ddc91d8064636436f759f38..ab78600b4b48f1efefd7871f55750943c1963dee --pretty=format:C:%H%nP:%P%nA:%aN%nE:%aE%nR:%cN%nF:%cE%nD:%at%n5:%s%nB:%b%n@@fe_body_end@@" in [/var/www/fecru/var/cache/in/clone] 
com.atlassian.utils.process.ProcessException: 
com.atlassian.fisheye.dvcs.handler.DvcsProcessRuntimeException: 
com.atlassian.fisheye.dvcs.handler.DvcsProcessException: Error while communicating with VCS: 
com.atlassian.fisheye.dvcs.handler.DvcsProcessRuntimeException: 
com.atlassian.fisheye.dvcs.handler.DvcsProcessException: Error while communicating with VCS: 
com.atlassian.fisheye.dvcs.handler.DvcsProcessException: Error while communicating with VCS: 
com.atlassian.utils.process.ProcessException: While executing: "git diff -C --find-copies-harder --no-abbrev --full-index -UO 46b53509c9d384f697306480993df888c9058f..61d862daa5290309d708d365423a998377d584b4" in [/var/www/fecru/var/cache/in/clone] 
com.atlassian.utils.process.ProcessException: 
java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: 209 
java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: 209
{code}

Having no idea what to look for (since the error doesn't really point out the problem), I ran this command to look for lines in the changes that are longer than 209 characters:
{code}
git diff -C --find-copies-harder --no-abbrev --full-index -U0 46b85af50ec9d384fe9730648c993dfe88c9c58f..61d862daa52e030ed7c8d36542aaee8377d584b4 | grep  '.\{209,\}'
{code}

I found one interesting line: 
{code}
diff --git a/vendor/liip/imagine-bundle/Liip/ImagineBundle/Tests/Fixtures/assets/%F0%C9%F0%F4%F0%F4%F0%F9.jpeg "b/vendor/liip/imagine-bundle/Liip/ImagineBundle/Tests/Fixtures/assets/\320\220\320\223\320\223\320\227.jpeg"
{code}

Calculating the line length with and without interpreting unicode characters looked promising as the candidate for this error. Having no other idea what makes Crucible complain, we rebased and removed that file and suddenly everything was working again.

So obviously there is something wrong in processing changes that contain filenames with unicode characters. I wonder that no one ran into this problem before (at least I didn't find a ticket related to that problem).

To reproduce the issue: just add a file containing unicode characters to the git repository (i.e. АГГЗ.txt) and let Crucible index the changes. That should trigger the error.
fields.summary: Error when indexing git commits containing unicode filenames

fields.description:
After adding Mention [~oldusername] to a comment, the oldusername is changed to be newusername.

This Mention [~oldusername] is not rendered to be a link to the user anymore.

Is it possible to use user ID instead of username in the Mention?
fields.summary: Mentions don't support username change

fields.description:
Perhaps its not a bug, but it seems unnecessary.

I have 16 things in my review inbox.  It tells me I have 16 things.  But it will only show me 10.  This makes it hard to decide what is the most important thing and navigate to it quickly.
fields.summary: Can only see 10 items in the post close/complete review dialog

fields.description:
If the thread calling ReviewService doesn't have a disposer defined (for example didn't come through CrucibleFilter), calling some methods of ReviewService will cause an exception.

{code}
java.lang.IllegalStateException: a disposer has not been initialized for this thread
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.util.Disposer.threadInstance(Disposer.java:100)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryHandle.acquireEngine(RepositoryHandle.java:477)
	at com.cenqua.crucible.revision.source.RepositorySource.<init>(RepositorySource.java:111)
	at com.cenqua.crucible.revision.source.DefaultSourceFactory.makeRepositorySource(DefaultSourceFactory.java:99)
	at com.cenqua.crucible.revision.source.DefaultSourceFactory.makeSource(DefaultSourceFactory.java:95)
	at com.cenqua.crucible.revision.source.DefaultSourceFactory.getSource(DefaultSourceFactory.java:71)
	at com.atlassian.crucible.spi.impl.DefaultReviewService$6.doInTransaction(DefaultReviewService.java:581)
	at com.atlassian.crucible.spi.impl.DefaultReviewService$6.doInTransaction(DefaultReviewService.java:574)
	at com.atlassian.fisheye.spi.impl.DefaultTxTemplate.execute(DefaultTxTemplate.java:126)
	at com.atlassian.fisheye.spi.impl.DefaultTxTemplate.execute(DefaultTxTemplate.java:114)
...
	at com.atlassian.crucible.spi.impl.DefaultReviewService.addChangesetsToReview(DefaultReviewService.java:574)
...
{code}

A workaround is to manage the Disposer manually, but that's not api nor should it be exposed to the user.
fields.summary: ReviewService methods using RepositorySources may fail if there's no Disposer defined

fields.description: Currently only a warning message is displayed if not all the reviewers have completed work on a review. There could be an option to enforce this requirement and the workflow to actually prevent closure/completion of such reviews, even for authors/moderators.
fields.summary: Supply the option to disable closure of a review before all the reviewers have contributed

fields.description: The customer said it would be nice if in Crowd you can say who is a Crucible user, so that the admins in Crucible don't have to check the Crucible user checkbox for each Crucible.
fields.summary: Manage Crucible users in Crowd

fields.description:
Crucible macros doesn't support Perl nowadays.
[noformat]
Unable to find source-code formatter for language: perl. Available languages are: actionscript, html, java, javascript, none, sql, xhtml, xml
[noformat]

This implementation would be really useful.
fields.summary: Source-code Formatter with perl support.

fields.description: It would be really nice to be able to "save" or "define" my preference as to the sort order (ascending/descending) and column(s) for certain pages such out what is in my 'inbox', 'outbox', and so on.
fields.summary: User Preference to save sort orders on various pages

fields.description: In review edit mode I can remove files from review but on-screen information that shows number of files in review is not updated until I manually refresh the page.
fields.summary: Displayed number of files should reflect changes while review is edited

fields.description:
In the Crucible documentation
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Configuring+Trusted+Applications+Authentication+for+an+Application+Link

we can read
"If your local application is Confluence, enter the following URL Patterns — /plugins/servlet/streams, /plugins/servlet/applinks/whoami"

twice, once for outgoing and once for incoming authentication.
fields.summary: Error prone information in the documentation

fields.description:
When accessing a diff in a review, we can set the view to Show All Whitespace. However, after reloading the same review diff, the view setting changed back to Hide Insignificant Whitespace.

It would be better if there is a default view option in Administration or User Profile configuration to set the view option for Whitespace.
fields.summary: Make whitespace option preference sticky per user

fields.description: Currently it is not possible not to select a default repository when creating a Crucible project. It would be nice if a "None" option would be available in the drop-down list for projects that are not connected to a repository.
fields.summary: Crucible Default Repository Drop-Down List Does Not Contain "None" Option
